abstract.shortdesc: In this scenario everything is still running (controller nodes and compute nodes) but you've lost the dedicated lifecycle manager.

body.p: In this scenario everything is still running (controller nodes and compute nodes) but you've lost the dedicated lifecycle manager.

Ensuring that you use the same version of that you previously had loaded on your lifecycle manager, you will need to download and install the lifecycle management software using the instructions from the installation guide before proceeding further.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Install the freezer-agent using the following playbook:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost _deployer_restore_helper.yml

Access one of the other controller or compute nodes in your environment to perform the following steps:
Retrieve the /home/stack/backup.osrc file and copy it to the /home/stack directory on the lifecycle manager.
Copy all the files in the /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/ directory to the same directory on the lifecycle manager.
Copy all the files in the /usr/local/share/ca-certificates directory to the same directory on the lifecycle manager.
Retrieve the /etc/hosts file and replace the one found on the lifecycle manager.
Log back in to the lifecycle manager.
Edit the value for client_id in the following file to contain the hostname of your lifecycle manager:/opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/scheduler.conf
Update your ca-certificates:sudo update-ca-certificates

Edit the /etc/hosts file, ensuring you edit the 127.0.0.1 line so it points to hlm like so: 127.0.0.1 localhost hlm ::1 localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters
On the lifecycle manager, source the backup user credentials: source ~/backup.osrc
List the Freezer jobs freezer-scheduler -c <deployer_hostname> job-list

Get the id of the job corresponding to HLM Default: Deployer backup to Swift. Stop that job so the freezer-scheduler doesn't begin making backups when started. freezer-scheduler -c <deployer_hostname> job-stop -j <job-id>If it is present, also stop the lifecycle manager's SSH backup.
Next, stop the dayzero UI installer:sudo systemctl stop dayzero
Start the freezer-scheduler: sudo systemctl start freezer-scheduler

Get the id of the job corresponding to HLM Default: deployer restore from Swift and launch that job: freezer-scheduler -c <deployer_hostname> job-start -j <job-id>This will take some time; you can follow the progress in /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-scheduler.log.
When the job completes, the previous lifecycle manager contents should be restored to your home directory:cd ~ ls
Start the dayzero UI installer:sudo systemctl start dayzero

If you are using Cobbler, restore your Cobbler configuration with these steps:
Remove the following files:sudo rm -rf /var/lib/cobbler sudo rm -rf /srv/www/cobbler
Deploy Cobbler:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
Set the netboot-enabled flag for each of your nodes with this command:for h in $(sudo cobbler system list) do sudo cobbler system edit --name=$h --netboot-enabled=0 done
Update your deployment directory:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready_deployment.yml

If you are using a dedicated lifecycle manager, re-run the deployment to ensure the lifecycle manager is in the correct state:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit localhostSkip this step if you are not using a dedicated lifecycle manager.
On the lifecycle manager, edit the following file so it contains the same information as it did previously: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/freezer/ssh_credentials.yml

On the lifecycle manager, copy the following files, change directories, and run the playbook _deployer_restore_helper.yml: cp -r ~/hp-ci/helion/* ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost _deployer_restore_helper.yml
Perform the restore. First become root and change directories: sudo su cd /root/deployer_restore_helper/
Then, stop the Dayzero UI installer:systemctl stop dayzero
Execute the restore job: ./deployer_restore_script.sh
Start the Dayzero UI installer:systemctl start dayzero
Update your deployment directory:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready_deployment.yml

When the lifecycle manager is restored, re-run the deployment to ensure the lifecycle manager is in the correct state: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit localhost
